State Management

State Management

Section titled ‚ÄúState Management‚Äù

bfloat‚Äôs state management strategy focuses on generating maintainable, scalable React Native applications with appropriate state patterns based on app complexity and requirements. The AI system intelligently chooses between different state management approaches and generates the necessary boilerplate and patterns.

State Management Strategy

Section titled ‚ÄúState Management Strategy‚Äù

Intelligent Pattern Selection

Section titled ‚ÄúIntelligent Pattern Selection‚Äù

The LLM analyzes the app requirements to choose the optimal state management approach:

  • üîÑ Local State: React‚Äôs useState/useReducer for simple, component-scoped state
  • üåç Global State: Context API for moderate complexity with prop-drilling concerns
  • ‚ö° Zustand: Lightweight global state for apps with moderate to high state complexity
  • üè™ Redux Toolkit: Enterprise-grade state management for complex business logic
  • üì° TanStack Query: Server state management with caching and synchronization

Section titled ‚ÄúZustand Store Generation‚Äù

For apps requiring lightweight global state, bfloat generates Zustand stores:

Section titled ‚ÄúRedux Toolkit Generation‚Äù

Section titled ‚ÄúHybrid Approach‚Äù

Best Practices Generated

Section titled ‚ÄúBest Practices Generated‚Äù

Type Safety

Section titled ‚ÄúType Safety‚Äù
  • Strong typing for all state interfaces and actions
  • Generic hooks for reusable state patterns
  • Discriminated unions for action types

Performance Optimization

Section titled ‚ÄúPerformance Optimization‚Äù
  • Selector patterns to prevent unnecessary re-renders
  • Memoization of expensive computations
  • Lazy loading of state modules

Error Handling

Section titled ‚ÄúError Handling‚Äù
  • Error boundaries for state-related crashes
  • Fallback states for failed operations
  • Loading states for better UX

Testing Support

Section titled ‚ÄúTesting Support‚Äù
  • Mock stores for testing components
  • State factories for test data generation
  • Integration test helpers for state flows

State Management Evolution

Section titled ‚ÄúState Management Evolution‚Äù

Scalability Patterns

Section titled ‚ÄúScalability Patterns‚Äù

bfloat generates state architectures that can evolve:

  1. Start Simple: Begin with local state and Context
  2. Add Complexity: Introduce Zustand for global state
  3. Scale Up: Migrate to Redux Toolkit for enterprise needs
  4. Optimize: Add server state management with TanStack Query

Migration Strategies

Section titled ‚ÄúMigration Strategies‚Äù

The generated code includes migration paths between state management approaches, allowing apps to evolve their state architecture as requirements change.
